SENT.plain: Cerebral venous thrombosis (CVT) is a relatively rare but serious condition potentially reversible upon accurate diagnosis and adequate therapy
The peri-partum state and pregnancy are predisposing factors and TVC accounts for about 6% of maternal deaths
Its clinical symptoms depend on the the thrombus site and extension, and also on the existing collateral vessels network
